title: Add in-app deployment link sharing and deployment troubleshooting guidance

requirements.text: Add an in-app way for users to obtain and copy the current live app URL (the deployment link) so the link can be shared without relying on past chat messages.
acceptanceCriteria: The header includes a clearly labeled action (e.g., ‚ÄúCopy app link‚Äù) available to all users (signed in or not).
Clicking the action copies a shareable URL representing the current app entrypoint (including any required hash-based routing) to the clipboard.
After copying, the UI shows a non-intrusive confirmation message in English (e.g., toast) indicating the link was copied.
The copied link works when opened in a new browser session and loads the app successfully.

requirements.text: Add a small ‚ÄúHelp / Troubleshooting‚Äù section accessible from the main UI that explains, in English, what to do if the app fails to load after a deploy/redeploy and how to retrieve/copy the current app link.

quotes:
üôè Something went wrong with the deployment

 Deployment error

acceptanceCriteria: There is a visible place in the UI to access troubleshooting guidance (e.g., footer link, header menu item, or a section on the album list page).
The guidance includes: (1) how to copy the app link using the new UI action, (2) a suggestion to hard refresh, and (3) a note to retry later if the canister is upgrading.
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Add a repository documentation file with deterministic steps for local/prod deployment and for finding the deployed frontend URL and canister IDs.

quotes:
üôè Something went wrong with the deployment

 Deployment error

acceptanceCriteria: A new markdown doc exists in the repo (e.g., DEPLOYMENT.md) that includes the commands/steps to deploy with dfx and how to discover the frontend URL after deployment.
The doc explains where canister IDs are found after deploy and how to verify the app is reachable.
No secrets or environment-specific credentials are added to the repo.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only Shadcn components); compose them instead.
Do not edit immutable hook/bootstrap files: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add backend changes if required for the deployment documentation, not for new product features.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Actually performing a deployment from within the app UI (deployment is handled by the build/deploy platform tooling).
Producing a native downloadable app binary (APK/IPA/EXE).
Adding third-party hosting, external databases, or non-Internet-Identity authentication.
